system.description: The true dealer of death, Necromancers are most at home in the cemetery digging up future minions. Shunned by most of society, these dark mages are not necessarily evil, they simply see death as full of potential energy while others see it as the end of life. Necromancers fear nothing, as they are always facing death. If you are playing a Necromancer be unafraid, kill without remorse and be interested in dead bodies, close to death yourself, almost in another world.

overview.base: You may rotate between @L[Category:Necromancy element spells]{necromancy} rotator @L[Category:Spells]{spells} during a @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest} instead of a @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}.
overview.proficient: You are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in @L[Ability:Necromancy Rotators]{Necromancy Rotators}. (This does not make you @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in the @L[Category:Spells]{spells} themselves.)

overview.base: When you @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack} with @L[Ability:Death Ray]{Death Ray} or @L[Ability:Terror Ball]{Terror Ball}, you may target an additional creature or the same creature twice. Any costs you pay must be paid twice and be the same for both @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attacks} These incur @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack penalties} as though they were two separate @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks}.
overview.fluent: You may instead choose up to 1 + @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} additional or repeated targets.

overview.base: Add @L[Ability:Augment Undead]{Augment Undead} and @L[Ability:Spirit Pact]{Spirit Pact} to your list of possible @L[Category:Rotator spells]{rotator spells}.

In addition to the custom rotator spells you create, you can learn @L[Category:Rotator spells]{spells} created by others. When you come across a fully created spell using only words you are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in, can make a DC 12 + OP @L[Core:INT]{INT} @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save} to attempt to learn it. If you succeed, you can add it to your rotator spell list. If you fail, you are @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of attempting to learn that spell again. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may modify the DC based on the spell's complexity, your knowledge of the spell, any special training you receive, if the spell's creator is there to assist you, or for any other factors they see fit. You may also attempt to learn words that you come across as long as they are of elements you are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may adjust the DC for these as they see fit as well, but the default is DC 15 + OP @L[Core:Intelligence]{INT} @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save}.
overview.proficient: You are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in @L[Ability:Elder Sorcery Creation]{Elder Sorcery Creation}, @L[Ability:Celestial Elder Sorcery Words]{Celestial Elder Sorcery Words}, and @L[Ability:Necromancy Elder Sorcery Words]{Necromancy Elder Sorcery Words}.

results.save: You learn the spell or word.
results.fail: You are @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of attempting to learn that spell or word again.

overview.base:
Once per @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}, you may cast a @L[Category:Ritual delivery spells]{ritual} @L[Category:Necromancy element spells]{necromancy spell} in half the time it would normally take. Additionally, once per long rest, you may cast a @L[Category:Necromancy element spells]{necromancy spell} as though you were @L[Keyword:Adept]{adept} at it.

You also gain the @L[Ability:Intrusive Casting]{Intrusive} and @L[Ability:Oppressive Casting]{Oppressive} casting styles.
overview.proficient: You may now use the benefits from Necromancy Disciplines @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} times per @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}.
overview.fluent: You may now use the benefits from Necromancy Disciplines @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} times per @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}.

overview.base:
Target gains 1 @L[Core:Common Undead Abilities]{common undead ability}.
Common Undead Abilities
1 @L[Ability:Martial Arts]{Martial Arts}
2 @L[Ability:Ethereal Shift]{Ethereal Shift}
3 @L[Ability:Gliding]{Gliding}
4 @L[Ability:Zombify]{Zombify}
5 @L[Ability:Animate Dead]{Animate Dead}
6 @L[Ability:Fear Touch]{Fear Touch}
7 @L[Ability:Vicious Bite]{Vicious Bite}
8 @L[Keyword:Gifted]{Gifted} @L[Ability:Flying]{Flying}
9 @L[Ability:Reflexes]{Reflexes}
10 @L[Ability:Death Rattle]{Death Rattle}
11 @L[Ability:Vitals Protection]{Vitals Protection}
12 @L[Keyword:Gifted]{Gifted} @L[Ability:Missile Weapon Resistance]{Missile Weapon Resistance}
13 @L[Ability:Improved Strength]{Improved Strength}
14 @L[Ability:Endure]{Endure}
15 @L[Ability:Shock Touch]{Shock Touch}
16 @L[Keyword:Gifted]{Gifted} @L[Ability:Spirit Bury]{Spirit Bury}
17 @L[Ability:Devour]{Devour}
18 @L[Ability:Maul]{Maul}
19 @L[Ability:Fear Aura]{Fear Aura}
20 @L[Ability:Temporary Charm]{Temporary Charm}

Target takes the "on hit" effect of a @L[Category:Conjured spells]{conjured} @L[Category:Missile delivery spells]{missile spell} that you are @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{proficient} in. If the triggering hit was a critical hit, then the target takes the "on critical hit" effect instead.

system.trigger: You have just landed a hit with a @L[Category:Weapon delivery abilities]{weapon} or @L[Category:Bite delivery abilities]{bite} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} on another creature and the effect has successfully applied.
system.limitation: Only usable with @L[Ability:Death Ray]{Death Ray} and @L[Ability:Terror Ball]{Terror Ball}.

overview.base: The range of the triggering @L[Category:Spells]{spell} is doubled.

system.trigger: You are casting a @L[Category:Spells]{spell} with a range other than @L[Category:Self target spells]{self}.

overview.base: You make a pact with some spirit, elemental, demon, outsider, or other supernatural being. In doing this, you are free to offer some sort of vow or sacrifice to the entity in question, but you do not have to. If the entity is interested in making a pact with you, they will offer you one that you can choose to either accept or reject. If you accept, you gain the benefits of the pact, but you must also fulfill its terms and live with the consequences of your choice. If you reject the pact, then you may not attempt to make another pact for at least 24 hours. The entity that you rejected is aware that you have rejected their offer and may not offer you another pact. Rather, they have likely taken offense to your rejection and may seek to punish you for it. When the pact is offered, you may not ask any clarifying questions, and you must accept or reject the pact as it is offered.
overview.proficient: You may ask up to @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} yes or no questions about the pact before you make your decision. The entity will answer truthfully, but will not offer any additional information.
overview.fluent: You may now ask up to @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} yes or no questions about the pact before you make your decision. In addition, you may ask one question to which you receive a more involved answer. The entity will answer this question truthfully.

overview.base: If the triggering @L[Category:Spells]{spell} is an @L[Category:Attack spells]{attack spell}, you make the @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack roll} with @L[Core:Advantage]{advantage}. If it is a @L[Category:Feat spells]{feat spell}, its targets make their @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save} with @L[Core:Disadvantage]{disadvantage}.

system.trigger: You cast an @L[Category:Attack spells]{attack} or @L[Category:Feat spells]{feat interaction spell}.
